DataElement.preferredName: Liver Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to a series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body or a procedure in which sound waves (called ultrasound) are bounced off tissues and the echoes produce a picture (sonogram) for the large organ located in the upper abdomen being performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Liver Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body or a procedure in which sound waves (called ultrasound) are bounced off tissues and the echoes produce a picture (sonogram) for the large organ located in the upper abdomen being performed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Liver Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Diagnostic Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
